column4: damn.. first real problem in 2 month of ubuntu 8.10 (for me atleast;) I logged windows XP to check some stuff.. when I logged back onto ubuntu I was unable to go to my shared drive.. "you are not privileged to mount the volume 'HUUUGE'" ( HUUUGE being my shared device) anyone knows what might be wrong? :O
what can you tell us about your permissions?
ben able to go to any of my paritisions right from the start.. I got root
how are you authenticating?  Guest or user permissions?
user I guess.. my own private computer..
I need you to check or know.  If you don't I cannot troubleshoot (it doesn't work).
never thought about auth since I never had any problems with access for anything at all.. where do I check?
you can check the /etc/samba/smb.conf for configuration details
thats nice.. I dont know what half of the lines in smb.conf means :) anyways.. the ones that matters looks fine.. but guess I will try on forums
use the how-to's ubottu point at for good directions for setting up samba.
I will look that up.. thx for your time :)
I would assume it should but check and test :)
It seams that ppl think that if windows crashes and I then boot onto ubuntu.. that might cause the problem.. that is what happend to me tbh :) so gonna try a reboot.. wish me luck ^^
can you show us the errors?  if they won't fit in a line use the pastebin (see topic, or ask ubottu about !pastebin)
just found a long error message.. but dont wanna post it.. what is the page for stuff like that? "past.ubuntu.org" or something like that right?
and IntuitiveNipple yea Im using NTFS-3g (I think)
I'll let you find someone who's familiar with ntfs-3g for help.  I won't be much :)
okay :)
most devices in /media are 'removable' so they may dismount on a reboot
you did all the work :)
not much work ey? ;) IntuitiveNipple yea.. so did I when ubuntu startet up without background and no media working :) good thing it wasn't cause I need my sleep now :) cya later! and once again thx
